sap.ui.richtexteditor.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor
sap.ui.richtexteditor.description: A rich text editor (RTE) control. Requires installation of an additional rich text editor library.
sap.ui.richtexteditor.helpDescription: A rich text editor (RTE) control. Requires installation of an additional rich text editor library.

sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.description: The RichTextEditor-Control is used to enter formatted text.
sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RichTextEditor. The RichTextEditor uses a third party component, which might in some cases not be completely compatible with the way UI5's (re-)rendering mechanism works. If you keep hidden instances of the control (instances which are not visible in the DOM), you might run into problems with some browser versions. In this case please make sure you destroy the RichTextEditor instance instead of hiding it and create a new one when you show it again. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEditorType editorType} : string (default: TinyMCE)
    • {@link #getEditorLocation editorLocation} : string (default: js/tiny_mce/tiny_mce_src.js)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGroupFontStyle showGroupFontStyle} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGroupTextAlign showGroupTextAlign} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGroupStructure showGroupStructure} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGroupFont showGroupFont} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowGroupClipboard showGroupClipboard} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGroupInsert showGroupInsert} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowGroupLink showGroupLink} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowGroupUndo showGroupUndo} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSanitizeValue sanitizeValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPlugins plugins} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getUseLegacyTheme useLegacyTheme} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getButtonGroups buttonGroups} : object[] (default: [])
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:ready ready} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeEditorInit beforeEditorInit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.helpDescription: The RichTextEditor-Control is used to enter formatted text.

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

showGroupLink.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Create Link and Remove Link is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupLink.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Create Link and Remove Link is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

plugins.description:
An array of plugin configuration objects with the obligatory property "name".
Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.
plugins.helpDescription:
An array of plugin configuration objects with the obligatory property "name".
Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.

showGroupInsert.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Insert Image and Insert Smiley is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupInsert.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Insert Image and Insert Smiley is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

showGroupFontStyle.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bold, Italic, Underline and Strikethrough is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupFontStyle.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bold, Italic, Underline and Strikethrough is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

showGroupClipboard.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Cut, Copy and Paste is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupClipboard.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Cut, Copy and Paste is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

value.description:
An HTML string representing the editor content. Because this is HTML, the value cannot be generically escaped to prevent cross-site scripting, so the application is responsible for doing so.
Overwriting this property would also reset editor's Undo manager and buttons "Undo"/"Redo" would be set to their initial state.
value.helpDescription:
An HTML string representing the editor content. Because this is HTML, the value cannot be generically escaped to prevent cross-site scripting, so the application is responsible for doing so.
Overwriting this property would also reset editor's Undo manager and buttons "Undo"/"Redo" would be set to their initial state.

height.description: Height of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.
height.helpDescription: Height of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sanitizeValue.description: Whether to run the HTML sanitizer once the value (HTML markup) is applied or not. To configure allowed URLs please use the whitelist API via jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist
sanitizeValue.helpDescription: Whether to run the HTML sanitizer once the value (HTML markup) is applied or not. To configure allowed URLs please use the whitelist API via jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

showGroupUndo.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Undo and Redo is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupUndo.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Undo and Redo is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

useLegacyTheme.description: Whether or not to use the legacy theme for the toolbar buttons. If this is set to false, the default theme for the editor will be used (which might change slightly with every update). The legacy theme has the disadvantage that not all functionality has its own icon, so using non default buttons might lead to invisible buttons with the legacy theme - use the default editor theme in this case.
useLegacyTheme.helpDescription: Whether or not to use the legacy theme for the toolbar buttons. If this is set to false, the default theme for the editor will be used (which might change slightly with every update). The legacy theme has the disadvantage that not all functionality has its own icon, so using non default buttons might lead to invisible buttons with the legacy theme - use the default editor theme in this case.

buttonGroups.description: An array of button configurations. These configurations contain the names of buttons as array in the property "buttons" and the name of the group in "name", they can also contain the "row" where the buttons should be placed, a "priority" and whether the buttons are "visible". See method addButtonGroup() for more details on the structure of the objects in this array.
buttonGroups.helpDescription: An array of button configurations. These configurations contain the names of buttons as array in the property "buttons" and the name of the group in "name", they can also contain the "row" where the buttons should be placed, a "priority" and whether the buttons are "visible". See method addButtonGroup() for more details on the structure of the objects in this array.

editable.description: Whether the editor content can be modified by the user. When set to "false" there might not be any editor toolbar.
editable.helpDescription: Whether the editor content can be modified by the user. When set to "false" there might not be any editor toolbar.

editorLocation.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.25.0 The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.
Relative or absolute URL where the editor is available. Must be on the same server. Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.
editorLocation.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.25.0 The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.
Relative or absolute URL where the editor is available. Must be on the same server. Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

showGroupFont.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Font, Font Size and Colors is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupFont.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Font, Font Size and Colors is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

wrapping.description: Whether the text in the editor is wrapped. This does not affect the editor's value, only the representation in the control.
wrapping.helpDescription: Whether the text in the editor is wrapped. This does not affect the editor's value, only the representation in the control.

showGroupStructure.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bullets and Indentation is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupStructure.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bullets and Indentation is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

showGroupTextAlign.description: Whether the toolbar button group containing text alignment commands is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.
showGroupTextAlign.helpDescription: Whether the toolbar button group containing text alignment commands is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

width.description: Width of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.
width.helpDescription: Width of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.

editorType.description:
The editor implementation to use.
Valid values are the ones found under sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType and any other editor identifier that may be introduced by other groups (hence this is not an enumeration).
Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.
editorType.helpDescription:
The editor implementation to use.
Valid values are the ones found under sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType and any other editor identifier that may be introduced by other groups (hence this is not an enumeration).
Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model,
but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model,
but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

ready.name: ready
ready.description: Fired when the used editor is loaded and ready (its HTML is also created).
ready.helpDescription: Fired when the used editor is loaded and ready (its HTML is also created).
ready.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

change.name: change
change.description: Event is fired when the text in the field has changed AND the focus leaves the editor or when the Enter key is pressed.
change.helpDescription: Event is fired when the text in the field has changed AND the focus leaves the editor or when the Enter key is pressed.
change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

beforeEditorInit.name: beforeEditorInit
beforeEditorInit.description: This event is fired right before the TinyMCE instance is created and can be used to change the settings object that will be given to TinyMCE. The parameter "configuration" is the javascript oject that will be given to TinyMCE upon first instantiation. The configuration parameter contains a map that can be changed in the case of TinyMCE.
beforeEditorInit.helpDescription: This event is fired right before the TinyMCE instance is created and can be used to change the settings object that will be given to TinyMCE. The parameter "configuration" is the javascript oject that will be given to TinyMCE upon first instantiation. The configuration parameter contains a map that can be changed in the case of TinyMCE.
beforeEditorInit.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description:
Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model.
Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription:
Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model.
Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or the user explicitly pressed a validation key combination. Use this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or the user explicitly pressed a validation key combination. Use this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription:
Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model,
but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
